page.title: 01Ancaster Village
page.content: Ancaster village lies in gap between hills, formerly course of River Trent before last ice Age. Older part of village stone built. Majority of working residents commute to adjacent towns to work. RAF Airfield to south of block used chiefly for flying training for officer cadets from nearby air force college Cranwell. Sandpits to west of village are being landscaped and used for canoeing, sailing with owners permits. Two quarries produce high quality building stone in small quantities. A small nature reserve exists in Ancaster valley. A grain store and an agricultural trailer manufacturing plant exist in the village.
